This file is part of the Aura project for PHP.
Represents a data set.
docblock.long-description:
This is similar to the SPL ArrayObject, but allows you easier access to the underlying data itself. This class serves as a base for ...

  • the generic type object, where $data represents an IdentityMap;

  • the generic entity object, where $data represents the entity fields; and

  • the generic collection object, where $data represents an array of entities.

docblock.description: This file is part of the Aura project for PHP.
A manager for the types in the domain model.
A builder for type objects.
A builder for relation objects.
An array of type definition arrays, which are converted to type objects as you request them.
Constructor.
docblock.long-description:
The $types definition array looks like this:

 $types = [

     // the name to use for this type in the manager
     'some_type_name' => [

         // the identity field in each entity
         'identity_field' => 'id',

         // fields to index against
         'index_fields' => ['field1', 'field2'],

         // a entity builder for the type
         'entity_builder' => new \Aura\Domain\EntityBuilder,

         // a collection builder for the type
         'collection_builder' => new \Aura\Domain\CollectionBuilder,

         // relationship definitons
         'relation_names' => [
             // discussed below
         ],
     ),

     'next_type_name' => [
         // ...
     ],

     // ...
 );

The relationship definitions portion looks like this:

 $relation_names = [

     'name_for_relation_1' => [

         // the relationship to the native (parent) type: the parent
         // belongs_to, has_one, has_many, or has_many_through
         // of the foreign type. required.
         'relationship' => 'has_many',

         // the name of the foreign (related) type in the manager.
         // optional; by default, uses the relation name as the
         // foreign type.
         'foreign_type' => 'another_type_name',

         // the name of the native (parent) entity field to use
         // when matching foreign (related) entities. required.
         'native_field' => 'native_field_name',

         // the name of the foreign (related) entity field to use
         // when matching the native (parent) entity. required.
         'foreign_field' => 'foreign_field_name',

         // -------------------------------------------------------
         // if you have a has_many_through relationship, add the
         // following three keys to set up the association mapping.

         // the name of the type through which the native
         // and foreign types are mapped to each other.
         'through_type' => 'mapping_type_name',

         // in the "through" entity, the name of the field that
         // maps to the 'native_field' value
         'through_native_field' => 'mapping_native_field_name',

         // in the "through" entity, the name of the field that
         // maps to the 'foreign_field' value
         'through_foreign_field' => 'mapping_foreign_field_name',
     ),

     'name_for_relation_2' => [
         // ...
     ],

     // ...
 );

docblock.description: Gets a type by name, creating a type object for it as needed.
Builds a type object from a type definition.
docblock.long-description:
The build process happens in two stages:

  1. Use the $type_builder to create the type object.

  2. Add relationships from the type definition.

The two-stage process helps avoid race conditions where a type may have relationships to other type object that might not be in the manager yet.

This file is part of the Aura project for PHP.
Builds a type object from an array of description information.
Returns a new type instance.
docblock.long-description:
The $info array should have four keys:

  • 'identity_field' (string): The name of the identity field for entities of this type. This key is required.

  • entity_builder (Entity\BuilderInterface): A builder to create entity objects for the type. This key is optional, and defaults to a new Entity\Builder object.

  • collection_builder (Collection\BuilderInterface): A A builder to create collection objects for the type. This key is optional, and defaults to a new Collection\Builder object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of information about the type.

docblock.description: This file is part of the Aura project for PHP.
Describes a particular type within the domain, and retains an IdentityMap of entities for the type.
docblock.long-description: Converts loaded data to entity objects lazily.

docblock.description: A builder to create collection objects for this type.
A builder to create entity objects for this type.
The entity field representing its unique identifier value.
docblock.long-description: The IdentityMap will be keyed on these values.

docblock.description: An array of fields to index on for quicker lookups.
docblock.long-description:
The array format is:

$index_fields[$field_name][$field_value] = (array) $offsets;

Note that we always have an array of offsets, and the keys are by the field name and the values for that field.

docblock.description: An index of entities on the identity field.
docblock.long-description:
The format is:

 $index_identity[$identity_value] = $offset;

Note that we always have only one offset, keyed by identity value.

docblock.description: An index of all entities added via newEntity().
docblock.long-description:
The format is:

 $index_new[] = $offset;

Note that we always have one offset, and the key is merely sequential.

docblock.description: An object store of the initial data for entity in the IdentityMap.

An array of relationship descriptions, where the key is a field name for the entity and the value is a relation object.

Sets the fields that should be indexed at load() time; removes all previous field indexes.

Sets the builder object to create entity objects.
Returns the builder that creates entity objects.
Sets the builder object to create collection objects.
Returns the builder that creates collection objects.
Sets the lazy builder to create lazy objects.
Returns the lazy builder that creates lazy objects.
Loads the IdentityMap for this type with data for entity objects.
docblock.long-description:
Typically, the $data value is a sequential array of associative arrays. As long as the $data value can be iterated over and accessed as an array, you can pass in any kind of $data.

The elements from $data will be placed into the IdentityMap and indexed according to the value of their identity field.

You can call load() multiple times, but entities already in the IdentityMap will not be overwritten.

The loaded elements are cast to objects; this allows consistent addressing of elements before and after conversion to entity objects.

The loaded elements will be converted to entity objects by the entity builder only as you request them from the IdentityMap.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Entity data to load into the IdentityMap.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Return values from this field; if empty, return values from the identity field (the default).

tag.name: return
tag.description: The return values from the data elements, regardless of whether they were loaded or not.

docblock.description: Returns the array keys for the for the entities in the IdentityMap; the keys were generated at load() time from the identity field values.

tag.name: param

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of key-value pairs where the key is the identity value and the value is the requested field value.

docblock.description: Retrieves a single entity from the IdentityMap by the value of its identity field.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The identity value of the entity to be retrieved.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A entity object via the entity builder.

docblock.description: Retrieves the first entity from the IdentityMap that matches the value of an arbitrary field; it will be converted to a entity object if it is not already an object of the proper class.
docblock.long-description: N.b.: This will not be performant for large sets where the field is not an identity field and is not indexed.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value of the field to match on.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A entity object via the entity builder.

docblock.description: Retrieves the first entity from the IdentityMap matching an index lookup.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The field value to match on.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A entity object via the entity builder.

docblock.description: Retrieves a collection of elements from the IdentityMap by the values of their identity fields; each element will be converted to a entity object if it is not already an object of the proper class.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of identity values to retrieve.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A collection object via the collection builder.

docblock.description: Retrieves a collection of objects from the IdentityMap matching the value of an arbitrary field; these will be converted to entities if they are not already objects of the proper class.
docblock.long-description:
The value to be matched can be an array of values, so that you can get many values of the field being matched.

If the field is indexed, the order of the returned collection will match the order of the values being searched. If the field is not indexed, the order of the returned collection will be the same as the IdentityMap.

The fastest results are from the identity field; second fastest, from an indexed field; slowest are from non-indexed fields, because it has to look through the entire IdentityMap to find matches.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value of the field to match on; if an array, any value in the array will be counted as a match.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A collection object via the collection builder.

docblock.description: Looks through the index for a field to retrieve a collection of objects from the IdentityMap; these will be converted to entities if they are not already objects of the proper class.
docblock.long-description:
N.b.: The value to be matched can be an array of values, so that you can get many values of the field being matched.

N.b.: The order of the returned collection will match the order of the values being searched, not the order of the entities in the IdentityMap.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value of the field to match on; if an array, any value in the array will be counted as a match.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A collection object via the collection builder.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The field name to use for the related entity or collection.

docblock.description: Returns the array of all relationship definition objects.
Adds a new entity to the IdentityMap.
docblock.long-description: This entity will not show up in any indexes, whether by field or by primary key. You will see it only by iterating through the IdentityMap. Typically this is used to add to a collection, or to create a new entity from user input.

docblock.description: Returns an array of all entities in the IdentityMap that have been modified.

tag.name: return
